summary: This bill, the "Basis Shifting is a Rip-off Act," amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify partnership rules regarding basis-shifting transactions involving related parties. It aims to prevent tax avoidance by requiring gain recognition in certain partnership distributions and transfers, particularly when related parties are involved. The bill also includes provisions for gain character, basis adjustments, and accuracy-related penalties. Finally, it sets an effective date and clarifies that the act does not create any inference with respect to the economic substance doctrine.
